column4: i just upgraded to kernel 2.6.24-23 on my acer aspire one, along with a bunch of other updates, and now it continually spews error messages to the console. in recovery mode it panics because it tried to kill init
anybody have ANY ideas?
-> you are trying to kill init? how come?
no when i boot up using the 2.6.24-23 kernel recovery it panics because it tried to kill init before even the ubuntu logo and progress bar appear
-> umm can you try with grub option   single  to get into single user mode == recovery
in normal mode it sometimes panics because it tried to kill init, and other times it constantly spews mounds of errors
thats when it kernel panics
-> even in single user mode it panics?
other kernels work fine
-> i dont know how old that is, try to re-install it?
-> yes, and you can modify your menu.lst to make your old the default again
its the most recent update
-> perhaps its too new, for jaunty?
its running hardy, and i updated it using the software updater. i didnt do something like compile the latest build, i just updated hardy using the gui updater
-> i suspect the update screwed it up? did it finish entirely or somehow you have interrupted it?
it finished entirely, but i was fooling with compiz settings while it was updating. also, it was installing like 120 other updates on top of the kernel
-> well, i dont know what you have tinkered with,  reboot to the old and do a new update?
can i uninstall the new kernel, or just try a new update
-> you dont have to do anything to get back to the old kernel other than selecting it on grub menu
i know. so for now, until a new kernel comes out, i should make grub boot to the previous kernel by default
-> yw
